title: Judges reserving verdicts for years ‘an ailment’: Supreme Court
description: A litigant who approaches the court must get to know what judgment is given on his plea,” the CJI said. The same HC judge, Justice Rongon Mukhopadhyay, was found to have kept several judgments pending for years, even in cases where the convicts had appealed against their capital and life sentences. The judge had delivered the verdicts in those cases only after SC took judicial notice of the same.

description: Keen to project a message of ethnic reconciliation in the north-eastern state, which was rocked by Meitei versus Kuki violence, BJP is considering appointing two deputy CMs — one each from the Kuki and Naga communities, with Singh being a Meitei. Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki figure and former minister, is likely to be one of the deputy CMs.

title: Duty relief kicks in, now you can shop a bit more while abroad
description: Used personal effects like clothes and travel souvenirs are duty-free. New goods like gifts purchases abroad qualify according to new limits. Goods above the duty-free limit are dutiable under normal customs provisions unless specifically exempted by the law. These allowances apply only to goods carried on the passenger’s person or in bona fide baggage.

title: Grounded 787’s fuel control switch lock satisfactory: Govt
description: The first grounding occurred on Feb 1 after a malfunction was registered by the crew of B787 (VT-ANX) during engine start to operate flight AI-132 from London to Bengaluru. The incident was critical as the fuel control switch locking mechanism has been at the centre of the investigation into the June 12 Air India Ahmedabad crash.

title: Sustained PM2.5 exposure ups depression risk: Study
description: The burden was highest among urban metro residents, people aged 40-49 years, and those from lower-income groups. Regionally, pollution-linked depression showed stronger associations in eastern India, while anxiety was more prominent in the western region. Risks also peaked during the post-monsoon season, when pollution levels typically rise. he study went beyond overall PM2.5 levels to examine individual chemical constituents of air pollution.

title: From 126 in 2018, number of LWE-hit districts now 8 : Govt

description: Referring to the activist’s speech, the solicitor general said he had stated that Ladakhis could not choose their own representatives while China and Tibet etc have autonomous rights which is highly objectionable. “This is a preventive action so that he doesn’t keep repeating the things he (Wangchuk) said. The detention strikes at the very purpose for which the NSA was enacted. It will have a contextual meaning. Every state has region specific sensitivities,” Mehta said.

According to meteorological department, the state has recorded a rise of 1.5 degrees Celsius in average mean temperature since 1901.

Yogi said he had seen how criminals mocked the law and made the people of the state suffer between 2003 and 2017, adding that law and order was his biggest challenge when PM Narendra Modi delegated the responsibility of UP to him in 2017.

title: Aditya Birla Capital profit jumps 33% to ₹945 cr in Q3

title: India-US trade deal unlikely to prompt near-term decline in Russian crude imports
description: While govt is yet to comment on US President Donald Trump's claim that India will stop Russian crude purchases, officials pointed out that supplies had come down from Nov due to the sanctions on the two entities. Experts said imports are expected to remain broadly stable through first and second quarters of 2026-27, with the recent moderation likely to be offset by higher inflows from West Asia.

title: Markets celebrates as signs of clarity emerge from U.S.
description: The Indian rupee emerged as the best-performing Asian currency on Tuesday (February 3. 2026), registering a record gain of 117 paise or 1.28% in a single trading session to settle at 90.32 against the U.S. dollar

title: 8 opposition MPs suspended after chaos in Lok Sabha over ex-Army chief’s book
description: In a protest letter to Speaker Om Birla, Rahul said it was the first time the LOP was not allowed to speak on the President’s joint address, and it is a blot on democracy. The suspensions and bedlam have put a question mark on proceedings for Wednesday, when PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to reply to the motion of thanks on the President’s address.

title: J&K parties, orchardists hail Centre’s decision to shelve railway projects in Kashmir’s Anantnag, Shopian

title: World Cancer Day: The tests you keep postponing could actually save your life
description: World Cancer Day highlights a global surge in cancer cases, with India experiencing a significant increase. The 2026 theme, 'United by Unique,' emphasizes personalized care. Early detection through screening, though underutilized, is crucial, alongside lifestyle changes for prevention. Experts stress the importance of regular check-ups and addressing common warning signs.

title: Jaishankar meets Rubio in Washington ahead of critical minerals ministerial meet
description: The United States is set to host the inaugural critical minerals ministerial on Wednesday (local time) in Washington DC, bringing together delegations from more than 50 countries to deepen cooperation on securing and diversifying global critical mineral supply chains, according to a notice issued earlier by the US State Department’s Office of the Spokesperson.

title: Govt collects health cess, but spends less than it did earlier
description: When the health cess was introduced, the understanding was that it would boost health expenditure by topping up what the govt was already allocating. Clearly, that has not happened. Instead, cess is masking what would otherwise be a steep cut in the share of health in total Budget and in GDP. From 0.32% of the GDP in 2019, the year before Covid struck, the share has fallen to 0.27% even with the cess component.

title: Act against officers responsible for fabricating evidence: court to Delhi Police chief

It comes just a week after the Adani company and Brazilian aerospace major Embraer announced a strategic collaboration for setting up a fixed-wing aircraft manufacturing facility in India.

title: Rahul claims PM is ‘under US pressure’, ‘selling away blood & sweat’ of farmers

title: US Navy shoots down ‘aggressively approaching’ Iranian drone in Arabian Sea
description: The shootdown came within hours of another confrontation in the region, during which Iranian forces harassed a US-flagged and US-crewed merchant vessel transiting the Strait of Hormuz, according to the US military. US Central Command said the Shahed-139 drone was downed by an F-35C fighter jet operating from the Abraham Lincoln, which was sailing roughly 500 miles (800 kilometres) from Iran’s southern coast at the time. The statement added that no American personnel were injured and no equipment was damaged.

title: 26-year-old fintech startup founder charged with US visa fraud and lying
description: A Turkish tech executive has been indicted for defrauding venture capitalists of $7 million in seed money. Gokce Guven allegedly used false financial statements and fabricated documents to secure investments for her fintech company, Kalder Inc. The proceeds were then used to obtain an O-1A "extraordinary ability" visa through similar misrepresentations.
